Learn More & Join Download Assignment PDF Before You Shoot â€¢ Scout locations where patterns and repetitions are likely to be found, such as architecture, nature, or urban settings. â€¢ Consider the time of day for optimal lighting conditions that enhance texture and contrast. â€¢ Prepare your camera and lenses, ensuring they are clean and in good working condition. â€¢ Familiarize yourself with your camera settings, especially those related to exposure and focus. â€¢ Carry a notebook to jot down ideas and potential compositions during your shoot. The Assignment Technical Focus â€¢ Shoot at f/8, 1/250s, ISO 200 in manual mode to achieve a deep depth of field, allowing multiple layers of patterns to be in focus. â€¢ Use a shutter speed of 1/500s, ISO 400, and f/5.6 in aperture priority mode to freeze motion in dynamic patterns, like moving crowds or flowing water. â€¢ Set your camera to shoot in RAW format to retain maximum detail for post-processing. â€¢ Adjust the white balance to match the lighting conditions, ensuring colors are accurately represented in your patterns. â€¢ Use spot metering to focus on a specific area of your composition, ensuring the patterns are well-exposed. Creative Focus â€¢ Look for leading lines that guide the viewer's eye through the patterns in your composition. â€¢ Experiment with different angles and perspectives to find unique ways to showcase repetition. â€¢ Incorporate negative space to emphasize the patterns and create a sense of balance. â€¢ Use framing techniques to isolate patterns, drawing attention to the repetition in the scene. â€¢ Play with color contrast to enhance the visual rhythm in your photographs. Assignment Tasks â€¢ Capture a series of three images focusing on architectural patterns, shooting at f/8, 1/125s, ISO 100 in aperture priority mode. â€¢ Photograph a natural scene that exhibits rhythm, using f/4, 1/60s, ISO 200 in manual mode to blur the background and highlight the subject. â€¢ Create a diptych of two images showcasing repetition in urban settings, using f/5.6, 1/250s, ISO 400 in shutter priority mode. â€¢ Document a sequence of images that illustrate movement and rhythm, shooting at f/2.8, 1/500s, ISO 800 in aperture priority mode. â€¢ Capture close-up details of repetitive textures found in nature, using f/16, 1/125s, ISO 100 in manual mode. â€¢ Create a photo essay on a theme centered around patterns in daily life, using f/5.6, 1/200s, ISO 400 in manual mode. ðŸ’¡ Stretch Tasks â€¢ Develop a series of abstract images focusing solely on color patterns and textures, using f/4, 1/60s, ISO 200 in aperture priority mode. â€¢ Create a time-lapse video that captures patterns and rhythms in nature over a period, using appropriate settings for exposure and interval.
